Umarkote lawyers to attend urgent matter only

Umarkote: Members of the Umarkote Bar Association have decided to abstain from court works except urgent matters till April 15 for safety of lawyers, judicial officers, litigants and court staff in the wake of coronavirus scare. Masks would be provided by the bar association free of cost to litigants who come to courts for urgent matters, said association president Prasant Kumar Sahu. On Monday, the Nabarangpur district administration imposed Section 144 CrPC in the district.

Title: Gopalpur Port takes anti-corona measures
Article:
The Gopalpur Ports Limited (GPL) has taken all precautionary measures to prevent COVID-19 outbreak. A detailed process has been established wherein monitoring and screening all foreign and domestic ships and crew in addition to the directives and instructions received from the Directorate General of Shipping and the Union Ministry of Health are being undertaken.

Any vessel having its port of origin from countries like China, Korea, Japan, Italy, etc., are being quarantined for 14 days. For vessels other than the impacted countries, pre-arrival reporting form declaring good health of all crew is sought 24 hours prior to arrival.

The port has also developed its own standard operating procedures (SOP) measures such as complying with International Maritime Organisations (IMO) and World Health Organisation (WHO) reporting form “Maritime Declaration of Health” and ports of call list that are being scrutinised by port health and marine team on a 24x7 basis.

An isolation ward has been created; and non-contact infrared temperature guns, N-95 face masks, disposable gloves and caps, fully equipped ambulance with three paramedics are available.

The GPL has undertaken a number of measures to educate its employees on hygiene measures. The port carried out mock drills and preparedness drive in the presence of the Ganjam district health administration and MKCG Medical Hospital teams. Indian Coast Guard officials visited the port and were satisfied over its readiness to handle COVID-19.

Title: Shopping malls, weekly markets, bars closed till March 31 in Gurugram
Article:
The Gurugram district administration on Wednesday ordered closure of all weekly bazaars, shopping malls and lounges and bars in the millennium city till March 31 as a precautionary measure to curb the spread of coronavirus.

The district administration on Wednesday issued a notification, ordering closures of all cinema halls, multiplexes, theatres, night clubs, gymnasiums, swimming pools and spas also in the city and elsewhere in the district.

As per the notification, the city pharmacies, grocery stores and super markets, however, have been kept exempted from the closure order.

All restaurants having in-dining facility have been restricted to the capacity of 50 seats. Similarly, all gatherings including social, cultural, political and religious ones too have been restricted to a maximum of 50 persons.

Owners of saloons, beauty parlours and grooming centres have been asked to sanitize their premises and ensure availability of sanitiser at their premises. Besides, private cab operators have also been asked to decontaminate their vehicles frequently.

According to the order, the public dealing at Government offices should also be minimized. Any person contravening the order shall be punished under section 188 of the Indian Penal Code, the notification said.

ANGANWADI CENTRES IN HARYANA CLOSED

Haryana Minister of State for Women and Child Development, Kamlesh Dhanda on Wednesday said the state government has decided to close the Anganwadi Centres across the State with immediate effect till March 31 to tackle the spread of novel corona virus (COVID-19) outbreak.

She said that the step has been taken keeping in view of safety of the children, adding that during this period, the Anganwadi Workers and Helpers will come to Anganwadi Centres to perform record maintenance, cleaning and create awareness through home visits about maintaining hygiene to tackle COVID-19.

Raw home ration will be distributed as per the nutritional and financial norms prescribed by the Government of India during this period.

Title: 6-yr-old Jeypore girl donates organs in UAE
Article:
A six-year-old girl from Odisha saved three lives in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) by donating her organs after death.

Divyashree was the only daughter of Arun Kumar and Kirti, a couple from Jeypore area in Koraput district residing in the UAE. She was suffering from pulmonary hypertension (PH), a type of blood pressure that affects arteries in the lungs and in the heart.

After she died a few days ago while undergoing treatment at a hospital, her parents decided to donate her organs.

Recently, her two kidneys have been successfully transplanted in a 7-year-old baby boy from India in the UAE and a 15-year-old minor boy in Abu Dhabi. Her liver was transplanted in a person in Saudi Arab.

With transplantation of organs in three different persons, the bereaved parents can see their daughter in them.

“We decided to donate our daughter’s organs following her death. Now we can see our daughter in three persons,” said Divyashree’s father.

Title: Food waste system unveiled in NTPC Kaniha
Article:
To step up waste collection management generated from its township, the NTPC Talcher Kaniha has deployed fully automatic composting machines.

The machines installed in Talcher Kaniha Township uses special micro-organisms to break down and decompose all kinds of organic waste into compost within 24 hrs with a volume reduction of 85-90%.

Each composting machine can handle 25 kg of kitchen waste per day and produce 2.5 to 3 kg of compost.

Catered towards a special focus on environment protection, the station issued two dustbins to its Township households to ensure waste segregation at source. To encourage residents to segregate their waste in separate dustbins for biodegradable and non-biodegradable along with electronic waste disposal methods, awareness pamphlets were distributed.

CGM Sudip Nag inaugurated it in presence of GM (O&M) NS Rao, AGM L Kar,DGM Manas Samantray, senior officials and representatives of the unions and associations.

Title: Corona concern is fine; panic by social media horrific
Article:
Ever since smart phone became cheaply available, gossipmongers turned hyperactive. The panic coronavirus has evoked, even among Government systems, is because of the social media. People need to know that around the end of 2019, this virus began making people sick with flu-like symptoms.

The virus resembles a ‘crown'. Hence, the illness is called coronavirus disease-19 or ‘COVID-19' for short. ‘Corona' means crown in Latin which how the virus looks.

People must know:

• Roughly 14% infected people need hospital care.

• Thousands have already recovered from infection.

• Covid-19 is 10 times more fatal than the common flu.

• The first symptom is usually a dry cough or sore a throat soon followed by a fever; and then, in some cases, fatigue. Some people develop shortness of breath around the sixth day after first starting to feel unwell. Other symptoms include headaches, dizziness and confusion, diarrhoea, difficulty in walking, nausea or vomiting as well as loss of appetite.

• Experts say mortality rate is between 1% and 2%. Most mild cases are not reported. So, the proportional death rate is inflated at 3%.

Until March 18, 2020, out of the 107,959 infected patients, only 101,544 (94%) are with very mild symptoms. Out of that, only 6,415 (6%) are known to be in serious conditions. As many as 90,768 cases have been closed; 82,779 (91%) have recovered completely and discharged from hospitals. Only 7,989 (9%) have died.

Incidentally, mosquitoes kill 2,740 people every day due to malaria complications.

Viruses, different from bacteria in physiology, can only survive in host cells by duping them with their genetic materials like DNA or RNA for multiplication. They are not killed by antibiotics which find no virus target to destroy. However, rare antiviral medications and vaccines are discovered from time to time for specific virus strains. Vaccines do only stimulate the host immune system to produce adequate antibodies that can deactivate and dis-empower the virus before it can cause disease by replication tricks in the host cells.

The first cases were diagnosed in people who had visited a market in China that sold live seafood and animals. The virus spreads easily if simple precautions are not taken. A doctor should be consulted if someone has prolonged fever, cough or other flu-like symptoms. It is very important that children have had all their vaccinations. It's not too late to get a flu shot as that too triggers the immune system strongly.

People, particularly babies and the very elderly with weak immune systems, need be protected with care. Most people with COVID-19, including children, do not have serious problems. They usually get better with rest and fluids. But it is important to keep infected ones away from others. Home isolation is a good idea unless symptoms are severe. Very ill ones get scientific care in a hospital with breathing help, IV fluids, and other treatments.

History has severally reminded the mankind that nature becomes unforgiving when the human race turns arrogant with artificial materials including food, gadgets and the works. No matter how sophisticated the internet, smart phones or jet travels are, the viruses will invariably remain indifferent to the so-called human progress.

Modern life squeezes millions into cities. Crowded planes and airports can spread diseases from continent to continent in hours unlike in the past. Diseases remain restricted to specific geography. Globalisation is a two-edged sword. It may enrich billions of people with material goods, but the effects of instant communication and travel can spread diseases at a speed difficult to fathom today.

Right at this moment, the entire human media across the globe is gripped by coronavirus. With warnings and alerts, people are bombarded with fake information and crap. Some create immeasurable panic; others keep spreading messages about untested, unreliable remedies that can cause more harm than the corona can ever bring about. The repercussions have already moved from the global health sphere into business and politics. Nation states are witnessing hard-generated wealth evaporating in hours at the stock exchanges as unfounded fear has brought economic activities to a grinding halt.

But there are reasons for optimism as ways to contain and defeat the virus are fast becoming visible.The first cases of AIDS were detected in June 1981; and it took more than two years to identify the virus (HIV) causing the disease. With COVID-19, the first cases of severe pneumonia were reported in China on December 31, 2019; and by January 7, 2020, the virus had already been identified. The genome was available on day 10. By January 13, a test to detect the virus was also available. Although viruses live by mutating in a confused host cell, the mutation rates are certainly not very high.

The situation is improving in China by strong control and isolation measures. For several weeks now, the number of cases diagnosed every day is decreasing. A very detailed epidemiological follow-up is being carried out in other countries. Outbreaks now are very specific to early-identified locations, which makes control and prevention much easier.

Even by today, the news is that 80% of cases are mild. In about 14%, it has caused severe pneumonia and only in 5% it can become critical or even fatal. Most infected people are cured. There are 13 times more cured cases than deaths; and this happy proportion is increasing by the day. Symptoms in children are so mild as to go unnoticed. Only 3% of cases occur in people under 20; and mortality under 40 is only 0.2%.

The virus can be wiped clean. It can be effectively inactivated from surfaces with a solution of ethanol (62-71% alcohol), hydrogen peroxide (0.5% hydrogen peroxide) or sodium hypochlorite (0.1% bleach), in just one minute. Frequent hand-washing with soap is the most effective way to avoid contagion.

It is the age of international cooperation in science and research. Within just over a month of the global outbreak, 164 articles could be accessed in ‘PubMed' on COVID19 or SARSCov2. Many more are available in repositories of articles not yet reviewed. They are preliminary works on vaccines, treatments, epidemiology, genetics and phylogeny, diagnosis, clinical aspects, etc. There are already vaccine prototypes. The vaccine group at the University of Queensland has announced vaccine production in record time. Prototypes may soon be tested on humans. There is big news that ‘chloroquine', an inexpensive anti-malarial drug has been seen to have potent antiviral activity.

The state machinery all over India has to keep people alert, not frightened. Fear may eventually cause more damage than the virus!

Title: HP to get Rs 454 cr for Disaster Relief Fund from Centre
Article:
The Centre has allocated Rs 454 crore for next financial year for State Disaster Relief Fund which was 158 percent higher than the last year’s allocation, Himachal Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said on Wednesday.

Presiding over the 6th meeting of HP State Disaster Management Authority here, he said that in addition to this allocation, the Union Government has allocated Rs 50 crore to the state for landslides and earthquake risk mitigation. He said that for the current financial year Rs 140 crore funds were available for disaster mitigation in the state.

The Chief Minister said the central government has sanctioned one battalion of National Disaster Response Force for Himachal Pradesh, adding that the state government had also notified raising of Himachal Pradesh State Disaster Response Force in line with National Disaster Response Force, to be the first responder in case of any disaster in the State.

He said that till the separate State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) was raised one company strength each would be stationed at nearby locations to the Police Ranges i.e. Shimla, Mandi and Dharamshala.

Thakur said the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA) has been focusing on strengthening of preparedness, mitigation and preventive measures from institutional to individual level. He said that the Authority has come up with a Disaster Risk Reduction Preparedness Project with the external bilateral assistance of Rs 800 crore to reduce risk and vulnerability of the State to various hazards. He said that the project has been developed under a multi sector framework with an aim to reduce risk and enhance resilience in the State.

He said the National Disaster Management Authority has also conceptualized a project National Seismic Risk Mitigation Programme for eight states viz. Assam, Bihar, Himachal Pradesh, Manipur, Meghalaya, Tripura, Uttrakhand and UT Jammu & Kashmir. This project aims at developing early warning dissemination system in case of earthquake besides enhancing emergency response capacity.

Thakur said the Government of India had decided to treat COVID-19 Virus Outbreak as notified disaster for the purpose of providing assistance under State Disaster Response Fund. He said that the state government has decided to immediately release Rs 5 crore in first instance from the State Disaster Response Fund to Health Department to take necessary measures to fight this virus epidemic.

Title: In Brief
Article:
separate community policing wing in Haryana

Chandigarh: In order to give a major fillip to community policing initiatives, Haryana Police has established a separate “Community Policing Wing” at Police Headquarters under the supervision of an Additional Director General of Police rank officer. DGP Manoj Yadava said, Police had taken several initiatives to involve the community in the process of policing across the state. The new Community Policing Wing which had been established will not only helps in bringing police force closer to citizens, but will also facilitate in proper monitoring of the community policing initiatives of Haryana Police. The new wing will primarily work to focus on initiatives of Community Policing, Community Liaison Groups, Student Police Cadet Programme, Raahgiri and Marathons and Mitra Kaksh in police stations. In addition, it will also monitor all other initiatives of Haryana Police aimed at community outreach across the state, he added.

Ban on holding events in Himachal

Shimla: As a precautionary measure from Coronavirus, Himachal Government has imposed ban on social, cultural, sports, political, religious, academic, family mass gatherings of any kind and purpose in the state with immediate effect. A spokesperson informed, the ban has been imposed under Himachal Pradesh Epidemic Disease (COVID-19) Regulations, 2020 for prevention and control of Corona Virus. He said that this ban would continue till further the orders in the state.

IIT Ropar moved all courses to online mode

Ropar: Indian Institute of Technology Ropar (IIT Ropar) has announced to provide online courses to students affected by shut down of the institute amidst scare of Covid-19 spread. This is first ever attempt of IIT Ropar to record about 150 courses for B. Tech, M. Tech, M.Sc and PhD students and the recorded lectures will be made available using Google Classroom and can only be accessed by the students registered in a designated course. In phase 1 the recorded lectures will be made available to the students which they can download and play at their own pace and time. This also includes release of assignments. On successful implementation of Phase 1, IIT Ropar will start working on phase 2 which would let the students interact with the faculty in problem-solving.

Start Up ThinkNEXT gets national recognition

Mohali: Mohali based ThinkNEXT - a digital media Start Up has bagged the National Gratitude Award 2020 for being the 'Best Digital Marketing and Industrial Training Company'. ThinkNEXT was felicitated at New Delhi recently with the award. Munish Mittal, Director, ThinkNEXT received the honour from Bollywood actress Sonali Bendre.

Title: UT to begin work on Sector 43 multi-level parking project soon
Article:
The Chandigarh Administration has swung into action for the construction of multi level basement parking between Chandigarh Judicial Academy and New District Court Complex in Sector 43 here.

The proposed parking will accommodate around 2000 cars in Sector 43.

As per the proposal, the multi-level parking will have one level of basement, ground floor and two upper floors. The approximate covered area for the project is 3,26,508 sft.

“An estimate of Rs 81 crore was approved for the project. The Administration has decided to hire a consultant for preparation of environment impact assessment study for the multi-level parking project in Sector 43 here,” said a senior official of UT Administration.

He said that the study will be done for obtaining environmental clearance from Union Ministry.

The demand for the multi-level parking was hanging fire for several years as the volume of cars and people visiting the Court premises has been increasing, the officer added.

The study of the proposed parking project will include aspects namely ambient air quality, vehicular traffic density, flora and fauna, water quality, socio-economic survey, vehicular traffic density among other factors.

The proposed parking will not only accommodate vehicles of visitors to the District Court Complex but also for surrounding spill over parking. It is proposed that vehicles coming to ISBT-43 and the Chandigarh Judicial Academy will also be accommodated in the parking facility.

Title: ASI-protected sites shut till March 31
Article:
In the wake of the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, the Archaeological Survey Of India (ASI) has announced that all its protected monuments or sites would remain closed till March 31 until further order. Also, the site museums including ticketed ones would be closed.

Online permissions in respect of photography, filming operation, entry fee, photography, cultural events issued would also be cancelled.

All officials posted in archaeological monuments and sites under the jurisdiction of ASI, Bhubaneswar Circle would remain present in their respective places of duty as usual. The decision was taken by Superintending Archaeologist Arun Malik on the basis of a directive issued by the ASI Director General.

The in-charges of site museums and sub-circles under the ASI, Bhubaneswar Circle were asked to affix the copy of the order at the main entrances or conspicuous places of the museums and monuments for public viewing.

Title: ‘Stop gate checking of +2 examinees at centres'
Article:
Hailing the appropriate precautionary measures in appropriate time by the Naveen Patnaik Government to fight the Coronavirus, front-line social organisation of the city ‘Lead Rourkela’ has urged the Chief Minister not to continue further the practice of checking at the gate of exam centres of the +2 examinees.

In a letter to the CM, the members of Lead Rourkela have appreciated the CM for ordering to close down the educational institutions and other institutions in a precautionary measure to combat COVID-19.

But keeping in view the career of the students, the pre-scheduled +2 examination is going on. The problem is congregation of more than 200 students in a queue in the gate of an examination centre for checking.

That may create problem for the students. So, abandoning the checking at gate is the need of the hour while the screening should be taken inside the hall by the invigilators, it said.

Besides, the organisation urged that keeping in view the heavy fine under new MV Act, hundreds of people are gathering at RTO office to obtain the requisite documents.

Where the probability of infection is more, the RTO offices need to be closed and time limit for producing the documents be extended.

Similarly, the organisation has also urged ADM Rourkela to take the social organisations of the city to combat the COVID-19. It further urged to intensify the monitoring systems in different organisations, institutions, shopping malls, business centre, hospitals regarding compliance and preparedness to the guidelines to fight COVID-19.

Title: Sambalpur girl fails to get Aadhaar card
Article:
Suman Bhoi (12) was quite healthy during her childhood. But at the age of 6 she suffered from fever and got jaundice affected.

Though her disease got cured. But she developed a new problem. That, all the 10 fingers of her hands didn’t function properly. At the same time, she also became unable to walk properly.

Suman has two other siblings, a brother and a sister. Her father Jaya Kumar Bhoi deserted the children and wife as a matter of practice in most of the working class family here.

Her mother Jangyasini maintains the whole family with four members including her with untold difficulties. She works as a domestic help to feed her children and meet their other requirement. But her income is too meager.

Initially, Suman was reading in a local school in the primary class. But ill- health didn’t permit her for so. She was unable to write a single word with here defunct fingers. Teachers also advised her to go to school meant for the physically challenged students and that didn't happen in her fate.

As per the latest requirement, an Aadhaar Card is now necessary for all purposes. May it be admission in school or for getting any help under different schemes including medical aid from district Red Cross society. But her defunct fingers are her problem as computer doesn’t accept her finger prints.

“I have applied for Suman's Aadhaar card many a time. But all the times failure reports came due to her deformed fingers. And no one guides me what to do next,” says Jangyasini, the mother of Suman. “The result being I am unable to get any help from Government for this girl,” she added.

When contacted, CDMO of Sambalpur Dr SB Patel said: “I can’t say about Aadhaar card. But if she comes to the medical, we can begin treatment and if necessary can send her to Burla MCH for further consultation. Let’s motivate her to consult the doctors first.”

Sub collector of Sambalpur Aniruddha Padhan also expressed his inability to help in the matter.

Title: Badal demands arrest, probe against Cong leaders
Article:
Punjab’s five-time Chief Minister and Akali supremo Parkash Singh Badal on Wednesday asked his successor Capt Amarinder Singh to share with the people why his Government was not acting against the Congress leaders — Kushaldeep Singh Kiki Dhillon and Gurpreet Singh Kangar — despite “clear evidence and written complaints against them for putting political, official and psychological pressure on the key witness in the painful Behbal Kalan incident, leading to his death”.

Badal demanded that the accused in the prime eye-witness Surjit Singh’s alleged “murder through emotional torture” be arrested on charges of interfering with the due process of law and they must be questioned on the motives behind their attempts to coerce the eye witness to change his stance.

“The hapless widow of the principal eye witness has been going from pillar to post seeking action against the Congress leaders alleging that they put her husband under unbearable strain to coerce him to change his statement and tell lies on the most crucial link in the chain of sacrilege events. Why is she being denied justice?” asked the Akali stalwart.

He said that it was for Capt Amarinder, his party’s and his government now to prove their guiltlessness. “One of the best ways to do so is to take credible and transparent action against his colleagues whom the unfortunate widow is accusing of killing her husband through mental torture,” he said.

Badal pointed that the Congress used to “ask us why we were not able to unearth the conspiracy in a year and half of our government after Behbal and Bargadi. Now, twice the number of years has passed since the Amarinder Government came to power on the back of some false promises made on oath of a holy scriptures. And at the end of these three years, the only thing that has emerged is that the Congress Government is merely trying to shield the guilty and suppress the wider conspiracy as they seem to be scared of the footprints leading to their door. They are clearly trying to cover some tracks”.

At the same time, Badal asked Capt Amarinder to get out of his habit of foul mouthing his opponents and critics every time he is cornered. “It behoves neither his age nor the dignity of the high office he holds to keep abusing others like a rude, ill-mannered teenager. He may be young but must a CM act like a spoilt brat? He must behave is age and stature as CM,” he added.

Title: ‘Withdraw platform ticket price hike’
Article:
Samajwadi Party State president Rabi Behera on Wednesday demanded that the Railways withdraw the decision to hike platform tickets from Rs 10 to Rs 50 at the Bhubaneswar, Cuttack, Puri Bhadrak, Sambalpur and other railway stations in the State.

Behera said that while the Railways is claiming that they have increased the platform ticket prices to avoid crowding of the railway stations to prevent outbreak of coronavirus, the truth is that due to the epidemic scare a huge number of tickets have been cancelled by the passengers, due to which the Railways is facing a financial crunch. To recover the losses, the Railways is passing on the burden to the common people. He demanded the Railway Minister’s intervention in the matter immediately to roll back the platform ticket price hike.

Title: Harsimrat asks CM to complete Ladhowal Food Park
Article:
Asking Punjab Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh to bestow “serious attention” to the Ladhowal mega food park project and ensure its early completion, the Union Food Processing Industries Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal said that “lethargy” on the part of the Congress-led Punjab Government had delayed the project by two years and deprived farmers and youth of its benefits.

Harsimrat, in a letter to the Chief Minister, said that the mega food park was approved by Food Processing Ministry in 2015 with a grant in aid of Rs 50 crore out of which Rs 35 crore had been released to Punjab Agro Industries Corporation (PAIC), which is the implementing agency.

“The project had a completion deadline of 2018 but poor planning and slow decision making of the Congress Government had resulted in frequent changes in the project components due to which PAIC had repeatedly missed target timelines for completion of the project,” she said.

Harsimrat, who was replying to the Chief Minister’s letter requesting for release of the fourth and final instalment of the Ministry of Food Processing Industry grant for the project, informed Capt Amarinder that he was not updated about the project’s correct position.

She said that the progress of implementation was also reviewed by the Food Processing Ministry’s Additional Secretary and it was noted that major facilities had not been made operational. “In view of all these facts, it would not be possible to release the fourth and final instalment of grant in aid of Rs 10 crore to PAIC. I am constrained by the scheme guidelines which clearly stated that the final instalment could only be released following completion of the project which would include expenditure of 100 per cent contribution of the Implementing Agency, allotment of 75 per cent of total plots and commencement of operations in at least 25 per cent of the allotted units,” she said.

Title: Criminals go scot-free as police show laxity
Article:
The police are inactive against certain influential people despite their involvement in serious offences in Keonjhar district.

As per rules after receiving a complaint of a cognizable offence ,it is the primary duty of the police to register an FIR and arrest the culprit and inquire into the matter but it is alleged that police under pressure were mute spectators in a handful of cases.

It indicates that there is complete failure of any impact of 5T and Mo Sarkar in the district, alleged the locals.

This has come to light recently on February 23, when one Purnachandra Barik and one Maheswar Barik of Unchbali village under Joda block made a complaint in Bamebari police station that they had been brutally attacked by one Sanjay Barik and 21 others after being dragged from their houses.

However, the police were not taking action against the accused for which they were moving freely even after passing of 21 days.

It is alleged by the duo victims that police were showing tacit support to the accused not just in their case but in many other cases too.

Prior to this , two other cases: case No. 18/ 19 dt.07.12.2019 and case No. 1/20 dt.27.01.2020 under different sections of IPC including Section 25 of the Arms Act, were still pending in the name of Sanjay and others.

Sources further revealed that some days back , accused Sanjay was a close confidant of former Champua MLA Sanatan Mahakud but being envious of Mahakud's influence, some mining companies worked behind the scene to field Sanjay to counter Mahakud. With the support of a mining company ,a cooperative society named as ' Baba Dhabaleswar Committee' was formed with Sanjay as its main trusty to undertake mining work but problem started after some days when the members revolted against him saying that Sanjay had betrayed them by not paying what he had promised to pay at the time of formation of the committee.

It is further alleged that Sanjay who claims himself to be a close aide of former powerful Minister and MLA Badrinarayan Patra also doesn't hesitate to attack his opponents who go against him.

On the other hand, local Government officials , knowing fully well that there is a strong corporate lobby behind Sanjay ,are also allegedly ignoring all the allegations levelled against Sanjay and Baba Dhabaleswar Committee . Recently, ZP member Basudev Naik had raised an allegation in the last Zila Parishad meeting that Baba Dhabaleswar Committee had encroached vast acres of forest land aswell as adivasi land in the name of growing agriculture but no action has been taken as yet to evict the encroachment.

It is further alleged one senior police official who is working for a pretty long period in the district headquarters is trying to put pressure on the local police of Bamrbari not to take any action against Sanajay.

It is demanded by the locals that the district police administration should interfere in the matter and take action.

They too demanded that the post of Inspector In Charge of Bamrbari PS should be filled up and officers working for a long period in the district be transferred immediately.

Title: Anti-corona drive: Masks distributed in Jajpur Rd
Article:
The Jajpur Division of the Central GST and Central Excise here under the instructions of DC Sovan Kumar Mondal organised a Corona awareness programme.

Cleanliness and proper hand wash were encouraged among the dealers, business persons and general public coming to the office.

The officers distributed about 1,000 pieces of masks freely to the people. Superintendents Nakula Kumar Dhal, Suvashish Samal and Pankaj Das, Inspectors Shival Tiwary and TA Anirban Bala attended the campaign in which Udayabata Editor Dushmanta Kumar Rout joined as guest.

Lawyer Gyanendra Nayak, Samir Mishra etc were present. The Department will continue the campaign for some days and will distribute more masks in the area as many people are coming to Kalinganagar Industrial area from foreign countries regularly, said Dhal.

Title: Two held in Ganjam for false corona info
Article:
As many as seven persons were arrested by police in different parts of the State in the last 24 hours for spreading misinformation about coronavirus.

In the first incident, two persons were arrested on Wednesday in Brahampur in Ganjam district for allegedly spreading misinformation about coronavirus in Badabazar area.

The accused were identified as Subash Chandra Sahu (43) and Sudhakar Sahu (41), residents of Jaura Sahi.

As per police sources, the two were spreading false information regarding COVID-19 among shopkeepers in Badabazar and creating breach of peace in the area. A case was registered against the duo under Sections 107 and 113 of CrPC

In another incident, a youth of Badasingada village under the Vikrampur police station in Angul district was on Tuesday night arrested for allegedly spreading rumours about COVID-19.

The accused was identified as Jayakrushna Sahu (25). According to police sources, Sahu posted the rumour on Facebook regarding death of a person of Banarpal area in the district due to coronavirus at a hospital in New Delhi.

As a police team reached his village, he tried to escape but was nabbed by the cops. He was later arrested under Sections 153(A), 188, 504, 505(1)(b) and 507 of the IPC.

On Tuesday, four persons including three reporters were arrested y by the Town police in Kendrapada district for circulating fake news about coronavirus in social media platforms.

The arrested persons were identified as Shibashis Mohanty, Praffulla Das, Dhrutiranjan Barik and Niranjan Parida. The three reporters were the admin in Whatsapp news groups.

According to police sources, the accused circulated information about Prime Minister Narendra Modi being afflicted by coronavirus and later circulated it in several social media groups.

Title: Govt will continue to move forward on development agenda: CM
Article:
On completion of his three years in office, Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat thanked the people of Uttarakhand, adding that the Government is making all efforts to fulfil the aspirations of the people.

On the occasion, Rawat released the book “Vikas Ke Teen Saal: Batein Kam Kaam Zyada” along with Cabinet Minister Madan Kaushik, district Panchayat chairperson Madhu Chauhan, Dehradun mayor Sunil Uniyal ‘Gama’, MLAs Harbans Kapoor, Munna Singh Chauhan, Khajan Das, Ganesh Joshi and information director general Meharban Singh Bisht.

Expressing gratitude to the people for cooperating with the government, he assured that all efforts are being undertaken to meet the expectations of the public. He said, “Various major decisions have been taken during the past three years. On March 4, Gairsain was announced as the summer capital of the state. This was a part of our vision document too and we fulfilled the promise made to the public. The people of Uttarakhand have also expressed their sentiments in support of this decision. Our second major decision was the formation of the Char Dham Devsthanam Board. The Char Dham Yatra will now be conducted under this system. We had promised the public good governance and corruption-free government. Taking strong measures, we struck hard at corruption and proved that a government can be run with honesty too. For a transparent administration we initiated e-office, CM helpline and CM dashboard. Another major decision during this period was the start of the Atal Ayushman Uttarakhand Yojana. All people of the state are covered under this scheme while the referral provision has been removed.

For the first time in the state, the investers summit was held in which MoUs amounting to Rs 1,24,000 crore were signed. Of these, investments worth more than Rs 21,000 crore has reached grounding level. The government has taken various decisions and where there is scope for improvement, the needful is done.”

The CM further said that the impact of the double engine government has been seen in the all-weather road project, Rishikesh-Karnprayag rail project, Bharatmala project, urban development projects, air connectivity, Jamrani multipurpose, Saung and Mussoorie drinking water projects.

The State has secured approval from the Centre for projects amounting to more than Rs 94,000 crore. For both mitigating migration and encouraging reverse migration, the rural development and migration commission was set up. The commission has submitted its reports after detailed study on different aspects.

Livelihood opportunities for local residents are being developed through initiatives like 13 districts- 13 destinations and home-stay scheme. Growth centres are working to strengthen rural economy while the state is moving forward towards green energy.

Solar and Pirul (dry pine needles) energy policy will be quite beneficial for the mountainous regions.

Further, the air connectivity has also been expanded in the state with Dehradun now linked by air with major cities of the country. Chinyalisaud and Gauchar are also linked by air service now. Uttarakhand is the first state to start operation of helicopter service under the UDAN scheme. Major initiatives have also been undertaken for organic farming.

A separate department is being made for adventure tourism. Adventure tourism will be an important sector to provide employment to the state’s youth, said the CM.

Rawat further said, “In the future too, we will continue to move ahead on our developmental agenda. Furniture will be provided in all schools and buildings will be made for all degree colleges and Anganwadi centres.

For further enhancing connectivity, bridges will be constructed wherever needed. We have also achieved considerable improvement in the girl child ratio and will lay more focus on this.

Title: Boating, amusement park closed at Sukhna Lake
Article:
As a precautionary measure in view of Coronavirus scare, the Chandigarh Administration on Wednesday closed boating and amusement park for children at Sukhna Lake, the city’s main tourist attraction till March 31.

The sketch artists making the portrait of visitors at Sukhna Lake have also been banned at Sukhna Lake. Apart from this, hop on hop off bus tours in the city have been suspended.

In view of large gatherings at Government offices, the Administration on Wednesday also issued guidelines to all Administrative Secretaries, Heads of Departments, offices, Boards and Corporation to take necessary precautions.

A day before, the Administration had shut down another tourist spot-Rock Garden- for visitors till March 31. Also, schools, colleges, universities, cinema halls, shopping malls, gymnasiums, swimming pools, pubs, spa centres, video gaming centres and coaching centres have been closed down till March 31 in the city.

Wedding and pubs which serve food have been exempted from the ban on gathering of upto 100 persons. An assembly of more than five people has also been banned in Botanical Garden at Sarangpur in the city.

Meanwhile, the advisory issued for UT employees on Wednesday stated, “No Government employee will be allowed to avail ex-India leave except in case of extreme exigency. Employees of Administration who return from any country to India since March 1 should not attend work for atleast 14 days. They should self-quarantine at home and follow Health Department guidelines.”

“All potentially contaminated high contact areas such as toilets, door handles, telephones should be cleaned. If an employee shows symptoms of COVID-19 at office, the unwell person should be removed to an area away from other people. If the COVID-19 case is confirmed, the senior officials should contact the Health Department to discuss it and inform about the case,” it stated.

“Also, if an employee is confirmed to be suffering from COVID-19, an office portion should be closed for sanitation in consultation with the Health Department and all employees who came in contact with confirm case should home quarantine,” the order added.

The Administration had already begun screening of employees and visitors at UT Secretariat, Sector 9 and Deputy Commissioner office, Sector 17 here.

Till Wednesday evening, not a single case of Coronavirus has been reported in Chandigarh, which is a joint capital of Punjab and Haryana.

PGIMER RESCHEDULES OPD TIMINGS

To follow guidelines of social distancing, the OPD Registration timings of PGIMER have been rescheduled from 8:00 am to 10:00 am as against the previous timings of 8:00 am to 11:00 am, said an official spokesperson.

The spokesperson said that the World Health Organization has declared COVID19 as pandemic. Around 10,000 patients visit various OPDs of the PGIMER, Chandigarh to avail its different services.

One of the most important ways to reduce spread of this infection in community, as declared by various experts, is social distancing. Hence it is very imperative to discourage crowd accumulation, he said.

The general public is requested that the patients who cannot avoid visiting the OPD may do so with only one attendant to avoid exposing themselves and others from possible infection, the spokesperson added.

Title: State hosps to get seamless power supply
Article:
The State Government has asked the Distribution Companies (Discoms) to take immediate steps for providing uninterrupted power supply to the healthcare institutions in view of the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak.

Secretary Energy Bishnupada Sethi held discussion with the senior officials of the Department of Energy here on March 16 and asked the Discoms to provide uninterrupted power supply to Public Health Centres, Community Health Centres, District Headquarters Hospitals and Medical College and Hospitals, other medical establishments in the State at the earliest.

Accordingly, the Department of Energy has issued orders to Cesu, Wesco, Nesco and Southco to provide continuous power supply to these institutions as the outbreak of COVID-19 has gripped the entire world.

In such state of emergency, providing adequate healthcare services to the citizens is of utmost importance. All the medical establishments, including the temporary quarantine centres opened by the State Government are required to receive uninterrupted power supply for their seamless functioning as they are likely to be the first point of contact by the citizens in case of any kind of health emergency.

The State Government has also asked the authorities in medical establishments to have power-back up facilities at their respective centres to face any exigency in case of temporary power break-down.

There are over 1,200 healthcare institutions across the State and Discoms have been shared the detailed list by the Department of Energy for urgent action.

Title: Corona scare: BJP not to hold public meetings
Article:
Gsoing by BJP national president JP Nadda’s direction in view of corona threat, party State president Samir Mohanty on Wednesday asked party workers not to hold any meeting, dharna, protest anywhere in the State till the situation becomes normal.

Mohanty also urged the party workers to create awareness for prevention of corona prevention outbreak in their respective districts, blocks and mandals.

“Workers have been requested to create awareness through leaflets and banners. The workers would form teams and create action plans to create awareness,” Mohanty said.

Mohanty said people can contact the Union Government through telephone no 011-23978046 and email ncov2019@gmail.com for any coronavirus related help.

Mohanty also said tha t all wings of the party would make proactive steps to create awareness on prevention of the deadly virus.

Title: 2 BJP, 1 Cong leaders elected to RS from Haryana
Article:
BJP nominees Ram Chander Jangra and Dushyant Kumar Gautam and one Congress candidate Deepender Singh Hooda were elected unopposed to the Rajya Sabha from Haryana on

Wednesday.

Returning officer Ajit Balaji Joshi said they have been declared elected unopposed to the Rajya Sabha. The declaration of the three candidates elected to the Rajya Sabha was made on the last date for widrawal of nominations.

All candidates for the Rajya Sabha elections from Haryana had submitted their nomination papers on March 13.

The BJP had named its backward class leader Jangra and party vice-president Gautam while Congress had named Hooda, its former MP from Rohtak.

Two of the Rajya Sabha vacancies had arisen due to resignation of BJP's Ram Kumar Kashyap, who was elected as party MLA in assembly polls last year, and the impending expiry of the term of veteran Congress leader Kumari Selja next month.

Jangra and Deepender had entered the race to fill these vacancies which would last a full term till April 2026.

A third vacancy had arisen following the resignation of former Union minister and BJP leader Birender Singh. Gautam has been elected to the Upper House against this vacancy for the remainder of Singh''s term, which would last till August 2022. Deepender had been a three-time Lok Sabha member from Rohtak. In 2019, he narrowly lost to BJP's Arvind Sharma as the saffron party had won all 10 parliamentary seats from the state.

KHATTAR CONGRATULATES

Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar congratulated BJP candidates Jangra and Gautam on being elected unopposed to the Rajya

Sabha. Accompanied by their family members and well wishers, Jangra and Gautam called on Khattar at his residence here who congratulated them and also offered them sweets. BJP State President Subhash Barala was also present on this occasion.

Title: B’pur Rotary on corona prevention
Article:
To check the spread of coronavirus, the Rotary Club, Brahmapur East created awareness programme at the railway station here and distributed masks to passengers, poor people and rickshaw pullers on Wednesday.

The awareness programme started on March 13 would continue till March 31, said club president Pradeep Kumar Panda and secretary Ranjib Patro. Leaflets informing about various prevention measures were also distributed among public.

Similarly, the One-Stop Centre organised an awareness programme against the virus near the MKCG Medical College and Hospital here. Administrator Maheshwar Padhi and ISRD assistant director, Sakhi Centre’s Snehamayee Padhi, Soumya Rani, Lipika, Madhusmita and Child Line officials Pranati, Priyanka, Prabhat, Balaram participated, among others.

Title: Sidhu to launch Dharma Yudh
Article:
Cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu on Wednesday declared to launch a dharma yudh (crusade) for Punjab’s welfare while asking the people to come together.

Sidhu, releasing the second video on his ‘Jittega Punjab’ YouTube channel, minced no words to attack the incumbent Congress Government and the previous SAD-BJP government of which he has been an active part.

He hinted at the prevailing corruption in the “system” for all these 15 years (10 years of SAD-BJP coalition government and the remaining of the Congress regime) to assert that he continued his fight till the time he was sidelined.

“In the last 15 years, I toiled hard in helping to form three governments in Punjab. But every time, I was confronted by the deeply-entrenched system which always lured me to join hands, promising rich returns,” said Sidhu in his piquant style adding that the system has become a curse in the path of Punjab’s development.

“Every time the system stopped me from working, I not only confronted the system but fought against it and didn’t move back an inch till the time I was sidelined,” he added.

At the same time, the former Minister also made it clear that his fight was not against any specific person, but that of ideology.

Title: Sundargarh man flees with brother's widow
Article:
A woman of Sundargarh lodged a complaint in Sundargarh sadar police station on Tuesday alleging that her husband has eloped with her widow sister in-law (wife of his deceased elder brother), following which Sundargarh Sadar police registered a case and started an investigation into the matter on Wednesday.

According to sources, Basanta Rohidas (38), a native of Tinikuda village under Sundargarh Sadar police station, had married about twelve years back and presently he has two children. Basanta allegedly had developed illegitimate relationship with her sister in-law (wife of his elder brother) few years back.

His elder brother, who was not maintaining good health had died about two months back.

According to the complaint of Basanta's wife, Basanta allegedly was ignoring her and their children, particularly after death of his elder brother. Basanta had fallen in love with his sister-in-law. Basanta reportedly had gone missing along with his sister in-law on March 13 evening, wife of Basanta mentioned in her FIR.

Sadar police station SI SK Sethi a probe was on.

Title: Draw plan to develop Tikhali Park: N'pada MLA
Article:
A meeting to discuss about the improvement of Tikhali Dam Park near Lower Indra Irrigation Project (LIIP) of Nuapada district was held in the project guesthouse at Khariar on Monday.

The meeting convened by Khariar MLA Adhiraj Mohan Panigrahi was attended by Executive Engineer (EE) Sitansu Sekhar Dash, Deputy EE of LIIP Sudhir Sahu, Deputy Director, Horticulture Swadesh Kumar Choudhury and the president and secretary of the District Press Club.

"The Tikhali Park has been developed by the LIIP. We have to now think how to maintain that, because, once the project office is closed down, there will be no one to look after the park," said Panigrahi. The EE, LIIP informed that much of the infrastructure has already been created in the park including the pavements. "What is needed is to develop greenary through plantation, drip irrigation systems and related activities for beautification," he said.

Members of the District Press Club suggested for convergence of various Government programmes like MGNREGS for improvement of the park. The MLA suggested that a detailed plan for further improvement should be made jointly by the LIIP and Horticulture department. "Once the plan is prepared, we can further explore how funds could be drawn from various programmes, including MGNREGS," said the MLA.

Title: Ganjam lawyer to skip court till March 31
Article:
The Ganjam Bar Association, Brahmapur on Wednesday resolved to abstain from court work, excepting urgent bail matters, from March 18 to 31 in view of coronavirus outbreak.

Association secretary Kailash Chandra Panigrahi has informed the decision to the District and Sessions Judge, Ganjam at Berhampur and all the lower courts.

Meanwhile, the Ganjam transport administration has suspended issuances of Learning and Driving Licences to prospective aspirants by till March 31. The district administration also made an appeal to the citizens to remain at home and avoid social contact. A control room in the district Collector’s office is functioning 24x7 to which citizens can contact in case of any threat or emergency by calling phone no. 06811-263978, informed an official release.

Title: State Govt removes ban on promotions
Article:
In a major decision, the Uttarakhand Government has decided to remove the ban imposed on promotions and restore its earlier decision of not giving benefit of reservation in promotions. After this order, the Uttarakhand association of general and OBC employees has taken back its strike. The stalled process of promotions would start within one week.

In an order, the chief secretary Utpal Kumar Singh while giving the reference of Supreme Court (SC) order dated February 7 said that the Government Order (GO) of September 11, 2019 stands cancelled with immediate effect.

The order also made it clear that the benefit of reservation in promotion would cease to exist in Uttarakhand.

Celebrations erupted among the general and OBC employees who were holding protest at Parade ground when the news of the order arrived.

The employees who were on strike from March 2 were seen dancing and applying colours on each other. The president of the association of general and OBC employees, Deepak Joshi said that the employees would join offices from Thursday. It is pertinent to mention here that the SC on February 7 while hearing a Special Leave Petition (SLP) of Uttarakhand government had said that the states are not bound to provide reservation in promotions and reservation is not a fundamental right.

The SLP was filed by the Uttarakhand government against the Uttarakhand High Court (HC) order in Gyanchand Vs state case. The Uttarakhand government made the order of SC as basis of denying the benefit of reservation in promotions which is being seen as a victory of general and OBC employees.

Title: BJP Govt of U’khand total failure on all fronts: Pritam Singh
Article:
The Pradesh Congress Committee (PCC) chief Pritam Singh has accused that BJP government of Uttarakhand is being influenced by sand, liquor and land mafia.

He said that the Trivendra Singh Rawat government is blowing its own trumpet on completion of its three years in office but the fact is that it has fulfilled no promise it made to the people of the state. The PCC president was addressing a press conference at the head office of Uttarakhand Congress here on Wednesday.

Taking a dig at the claim of chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat that he has freed the IV floor of the state secretariat from mafia, Singh said that the people of state had voted BJP for development and removing corruption from all parts of the state.

He reminded that the BJP in its vision document had claimed that it would set up office of Lokayukt within 100 days but after three years Lokayukt is nowhere to be seen and rampant corruption prevails in the state.

He said that BJP also promised to reduce price rise within 100 days but the prices are at their peak. “During the Congress government, the cooking gas cylinder was of Rs 414 but now it has being sold at Rs 950. The prices of petrol and diesel have increased despite of the fact that prices of crude oil have declined steadily,’’ he said.

The Congress leader claimed that the economy of the state is going through a bad phase. “If one removes the centrally funded projects from the budget, there is no provision for the developmental schemes.

The BJP had promised that it would waive off the loans of the farmers but this promise too has remained unfulfilled.

Thirteen farmers have committed suicide in BJP regime so far,’’ Singh quipped. Continuing his diatribe over the BJP government, PCC President said that a promise of providing employment was made but the government has sent unemployed behind bars for demanding jobs.

Terming the government’s claim to provide employment to 4 Lakh unemployed as laughable, Singh said that it appears this government has included those selling Pakoras outside railway stations in the list of employment provided by it.

He said that the Uttarakhand government has brought the Chardham Devsthanam board without consulting the Teerth Purohits and the stake holders.

The PCC chief claimed that the Congress when voted to power would abolish this board after consultation with Teerth Purohits. He said that in last three years this government has reduced the prices of liquor and done nothing to provide relief to the people of the state.

Former cabinet minister Dinesh Agarwal, Vice President Dhirendra Pratap, Rajkumar, Garima Dassauni and Lalchand Sharma accompanied the PCC president during the press conference. As a mark of protest, all the Congress leaders wore black clothes.

Title: Cong struggling to survive, venting frustration: BJP
Article:
The Bharatiya Janata Party has termed press conferences held by Congress leaders on the state government’s completion of three years in office as a “platform for frustration”.

The BJP state media in-charge Ajendra Ajay said that the Congress members have become habituated to writhing when not in power. He said, “The people of Uttarakhand have strongly rejected the Congress two times consecutively in the Lok Sabha elections and the last Vidhan Sabha elections. However, the statements being made by the Congress leaders make it appear as if they have not been able to come out their shock yet. The Congress leaders are struggling to maintain their existence.

In their struggle for survival, they are unnecessarily levelling baseless allegations on the BJP government,” said Ajay.

He said that the allegations levelled by Congress leaders in the Press conferences lacked substance, adding that there is neither anything new nor any facts in these allegations.

The people are also bored listening to these overused allegations. The Congress leaders should do some homework so that they can at least level some new allegations, quipped the BJP state media in-charge.

He further said that the Congress leaders are working on the policy of opposing for the sake of opposing. That is why they are unable to see any achievements during the state government’s three year term so far.

The BJP state government is moving ahead on its vision document released ahead of the 2017 Assembly elections. The double engine which Prime Minister Narendra Modi had referred to during the Assembly elections is benefitting the state fully. Responding to leader of opposition Indira Hridayesh’s questions on employment, Ajay said that this government had increased the age limit for applying for government jobs from 40 years to 42 years.

After the investers summit, grounding of 437 projects amounting to more than Rs 21,000 crore has been achieved in the first stage.

This will provide employment to 57,000 people. In the past three years, 13,484 units were established with 95,847 people getting jobs in these. Ajay also cited other statistics to rebut the allegations levelled by the Congress leaders.

Title: MCD expects NOC from UEPPCB this week
Article:
The Municipal Corporation of Dehradun (MCD) is expected to get the No Objection Certificate (NOC) renewed for its solid waste management and recycling plant at Sheeshambada from the Uttarakhand Environment Protection and Pollution Control Board (UEPPCB) this week.

Meanwhile, the chairman of Environment Protection Council, Vishwas Dawar inspected the said site on Wednesday and according to him, the management of the Sheeshambada plant needs some considerable improvements in the process of proper dumping of garbage.

The operation of dumping the garbage in Sheeshambada solid waste management and recycling plant without NOC is being carried out for more than six months.

According to the locals of Sheeshambada, UEPPCB has not renewed the NOC of Dehradun municipal corporation because of irregularities in the management of the plant. The locals have also alleged that the operation of plant without NOC is illegal besides other anomalies in the plant like improper treatment of leachate and foul smell in the area. However, MCD officials and the project head MA Saify had rejected all the allegations saying that the plant is running considering the NOC as deemed to be sanctioned because, as per MCD officials, the application of NOC was never rejected by the pollution control board.

According to Dehradun municipal commissioner Vinay Shankar Pandey, the process for the renewal of NOC is in its final stage and most probably the MCD will get the NOC from the pollution control board in a couple of days.

He also added that there are no anomalies in the waste management plant and the no harm is done to the environment during the process of garbage dumping.On the other hand, Dawar said that there are several anomalies inside Sheeshambada waste management plant.

According to him, Ramky Company that manages the functioning of the plant needs to do significant improvements in its garbage dumping procedure.

He further added that a notice concerning the garbage dumping in the plant had also been sent earlier to Ramky Company.

The issues in the waste management plant are not simple but with some efforts, the situation can be improved in the plant, said Dawar.

Meanwhile, the locals claimed that during the inspection of the plant, Dawar found the improper treatment of leachate, several dogs roaming around, a heap of mixed dry and wet garbage and numbers of rag pickers inside the plant.

The locals are protesting near the waste management plant for its shifting for more than five months claiming it to be hazardous for the people living nearby due to the improper handling of garbage collected from the whole city.

Title: Anganwadi workers to resume protest from April
Article:
The State president of Anganwadi workers Rekha Negi said that the Anganwadi workers working across Uttarakhand will resume their protest against the State Government in April.

The members of Anganwadi association alleged that the State Government had failed to keep its promise about forming a committee to enable the Anganwadi workers to directly keep their issues and suggestions before the committee.

According to the Anganwadi workers, the State administration had also assured them a raise in their allowances from April but nothing has been said about any of their demands since they withdrew their protest last month. “The State government has not taken any step towards meeting our demands yet.

We suspended our protest in February trusting the assurance given by the government representatives but now it just looks like as a ploy to get the Anganwadi workers back to their jobs,” said Negi.

She further added, “The women in Anganwadi association are not weak. We are the strongest support system for the development of children and women and responsible for the proper procedure of all the government schemes concerning malnourished children and mothers in every region of the State. We will resume our protest against the government from the first week of April when hopefully the coronavirus spread will not be threatening anymore.

This time our protest will be bigger than our previous protest.”It is pertinent to mention here that Anganwadi workers protested for two months and some of them also began a hunger strike to escalate the protest.

The strike of the workers affected several government schemes like the distribution of Take Home Ration (THR) under Supplementary Nutrition Programme (SNP) of Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) for children, pregnant women and lactating mothers and the pulse polio campaign.

On the assurance of BJP’s Mahanagar head Sitaram Bhatt as the representative of Uttarakhand chief minister, the Anganwadi workers suspended their protest on February 4. The demands of the workers include raise in monthly allowance, travel allowance, provident fund and health insurance.

Title: Guv takes stock of preparedness for COVID-19
Article:
Governor Baby Rani Maurya took stock of the steps taken to prevent the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) from the Health secretary Nitesh Jha and Disaster Management secretary S Murugeshan on Wednesday.

The Governor stressed on the importance of creating awareness about coronavirus. She appealed to the people to follow the suggestions and warnings given by the experts.

People should not heed false information or rumours but should take information from the government sources. Maurya said that every member of the society has to be serious and aware to prevent the spread of COVID-19. People who are being kept in quarantine or isolation should cooperate with the authorities.

The governor also sought information about the steps taken to increase the quarantine facilities. Jha informed that the government has adequate quarantine and isolation facilities. Four PCS officers have been deployed only to manage the quarantine facilities. Steps have been taken to stop the black marketing of sanitisers and masks.

Training programme has been started to increase the paramedical staff for the treatment and management of the COVID-19. There will not be any shortage of doctors. Private hospitals are being consulted for their future roles. All the arrangements are in place for the treatment of infected patients. The Health secretary further said that only those who have cold and cough or are possible patients of COVID-19 or people engaged in the treatment of infected persons need for wear masks, not healthy persons.Murugeshan informed that disaster management department was fully cooperating with Health department. Anticipating the various circumstances in future, preparedness would be ensured. District magistrates have been given full authority.

The governor directed her secretary Brijesh Sant that visitors coming to Rajbhawan secretariat should be permitted only if very necessary. Thermal scanner and sanitiser should be arranged for the Raj Bhawan secretariat. She also gave directions to make hand wash available for the personnel working in Raj Bhawan.

Title: Subarnapur: Screening at rly stn, bus stand
Article:
The Subarnapur district administration has decided to screen people arriving in the district at the railway station and bus stand as a precautionary measure for novel Corona virus.

At a meeting here, District Magistrate cum Collector Monisha Banerjee said a close watch will be maintained on Migrant Workers returning to Subarnapur from different parts of the country.

It has been decided to track their travel history and ask them to go for self isolation in their house. The Collector informed that there will be close monitoring of people entering and existing the district at railway station and nus stand by Government officials and volunteers.

To avoid public gathering,restrictions have already been imposed on marriage and religious events. Gathering at a marriage ceremony will only be limited to 50 people. At local haats, vendors have been asked to maintain a distance of one meter while selling commodities to people and maintain hygiene.

Officials will sensitise people to avoid large gatherings at religious institutions. It has been decided to carry out awareness drives at temples and different places of the district.

Title: Section 144 withdrawn in Bhadrak, Gajapati
Article:
In view of the revised instructions, prohibitory orders under Section 144 CrPC were withdrawn or modified in Bhadrak and Gajapati districts on Wednesday.

Earlier on Tuesday, the prohibitory orders, also imposed due to corona threat, had been lifted in Balangir and Jajpur districts.

Provision of Section 144 CrPC shall not be invoked either by the District Magistrates or police to enforce social distancing; rather, it should be implemented through IEC and awareness and media campaign, said an official communique.

However, restrictions would be in force on organising marriage functions and other gatherings. Strict vigilance should be maintained by all concerned to enforce social distancing in village and urban haats, public transport systems, public utilities, Government offices, supermarkets, temples, mosques and other religious places, banks, post offices, health facilities and workplaces for effective containment of epidemic.

Title: ‘Inspect Mahanadi riverbed encroachment’
Article:
The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered for an on-the-spot inquiry into the matter of Mahanadi riverbed encroachment at Ratilo in Kishan Nagar Tehsil under Salepur block in Cuttack district.

An NGT Bench of Justice SP Wangdi and Expert Member Sidhanta Das has directed constitution of a three-member team comprising Water Resources Secretary, Cuttack district Collector and a representative of the Central Pollution Control Board for investigation.

The team would inspect the area and verify on the factual aspects and submit a report before the tribunal before April 16.

The NGT gave this direction on a petition filed by Dipak Kumar Samantaray, a social activist. He complained about continuous encroachment and ongoing construction of a Panchamukhi Hanuman temple, threshing ground and proposed constructions of concrete structures such as toilet, graveyard, market complex and kalyani mandap etc that adversely affects the river ecology and disturbs the river flow.

He has also quoted a letter of the Revenue Divisional Commissioner (RDC) Central Division, which pointed out the infractions and the likely damage that would be caused to the environment, including obstruction of flow of water in the river.

The tribunal fixed the next date of hearing on April 16.

Title: 90 Nuapada farmers join calf rally
Article:
The BAIF Development Research Foundation, Odisha, organised a calf rally programme at village Dunguripali of Komna Block in Nuapada district on Sunday. Above 90 farmer participats of different villages of Komna block attended the programme with their calves.

The programme consisted of a technical session on dairy cattle management for farmers. Prizes were distributed to the farmers who had healthy calves. BAIF has been carrying on different developmental programmes in Nuapada district for past few years like artificial breeding, fodder production etc.

The organisation in cooperation with the Department of Animal Resource Development under Integrated Livestock Development Programme (ILDP) has been providing facilities to the farmers for improving cattle breed through artificial inseminations and animal management. A large number of farmers in the district have managed to upgrade their cattle breed and made diary remunerative.

ADVO, Nuapada Dr Chittaranjan Pruseth, Dr Basant Kumar Dhal, Dr Sukumar Munda, Dr Dibyasagar Duria, Dr Benudhar Mahanand and Kshetra Mohan Raut were the guests of Sunday's programme. BAIF coordinator Bhaskar Singh spoke in details about the programme.

Title: Banki murders: Mastermind nabbed
Article:
Police on Tuesday arrested the prime accused allegedly involved in the murder of a Congress activist and a journalist in the Banki area of Cuttack district on February 15. The arrested person was identified as Bhramarabara Pradhan. Earlier, ten persons were arrested in connection with the murder.

Congress activist Bhagwan Swain and journalist Aditya Ranasingh were waylaid and attacked by a group of miscreants with sharp weapons near Joklanji in Banki on the fateful day.

Aditya succumbed on the spot while Bhagwan died while undergoing treatment at the SCB Medical College Hospital in Cuttack.

Following an investigation, the Banki police arrested Bhramarabara on charges of plotting the murder.

Title: Keonjhar admn files case against NHAI
Article:
After receiving regular complaints from the local public against the NHAI authorities for lack of maintenance and non completion of NH20, the Sub-Collectors of Keonjhar and Anandpur have filed cases against the NHAI authorities.

NH-20 connecting Panikoili to Rajamunda was supposed to be completed by 2018 but only part of the highway has been built so far and toll taxes were being collected for last two years at several places of the incomplete NH. The Remuli- Rajamunda stretch was under construction while many portions between the Panikoili and Remuli were yet to be completed.

The Belbahali bridge construction was going very slowly and most of the highway instead of fourlaning was still single lanned. No construction of the four lane was going on between the Anandpur and Remuli stretch and the newly constructed portions were already damaged at different places for which road accidents were increasing.

Keonjhar Collector Ashis Thakre had instructed the NHAI authorities to expedite the incomplete work, road maintenance and completion of service roads earlier but his instructions went unheeded. Hence on instruction of the DM, the SDM Keonjhar and Anandpur filed a case under CRPC 133 against the Project Director,NHAI, CGM(tehnical) and Regional Officer NHAI for their neglicence.

The SDM Keonjhar had requested the NHAI for construction of a service road at the popular Sanaghagara tourist spot to avoid traffic problem and accidents which was yet to be carried out by the NHAI authorities.

Title: Corona Rath moves in Koraput
Article:
The Dhan Foundation, Semiliguda created awareness through a chariot named ‘Corona Rath’ at different places in Koraput district on Tuesday. Starting from Semiliguda, the chariot moved through Boriguma and other blocks to Dasmantpur, Koraput. It reached out to about 1 lakh people.

Samabeda Medical Officer Dr Roshni Xexa flagged off the Rath. Central Agriculture Officer Jyotsnarani Moharana, Orissa Millet Mission district coordinator Siba Sankar Sethy and all workers of Dhan Foundation were present.

Ladies Club leader Nalini Khandpan, Kabita Haria, Lachma Halab and Josoda Talab visited many villagers and created awareness to remain safe from Coronavirus.

Foundation health coordinator Jayant Kumar Moharana thanked all participants.

Title: State takes steps to tackle coronavirus
Article:
Apart from various precautionary measures taken in the state to prevent the spread of novel coronavirus (COVID-19), the state machinery is maintaining vigilance and undertaking necessary measures.

According to the health bulletin issued on Wednesday, till date a total of 794 persons from China and other novel coronavirus affected countries have been identified and tracked and all have been placed under surveillance.

A total of 390 persons have completed 28 days of observation after coming back from China and other affected countries while 356 persons are under observation as on Wednesday.

A total of 67 samples have been collected for COVID 19 testing till date.

Result of 29 samples has been received of which 28 are negative and one is positive while the result of 38 samples is awaited. Further, 27 samples of close contacts of positive case have also been sent for testing.

Quarantine facilities have been made operational in Dehradun, Haridwar, Nainital, Udham Singh Nagar, Pithoragarh and Champawat districts with the state geared up to admit any person who needs institutional quarantine.

Title: Kadru violence: House sees uproar
Article:
The Jharkhand Assembly on Wednesday witnessed uproar with BJP legislators demanding a probe on Tuesday night attack where some tribals moving on bus were attacked by miscreants near Haj House. The BJP on the issue demanded an adjournment motion which was however turn down by Speaker Rabindra Nath Mahto.

Raising the issue, BJP MLA from Khunti and former minister Neelkanth Singh Munda said, “Incidents like Kadru have gone up in State in past few months. The Government is anti-tribal as attacks on tribals have gone up in State.” Munda, demanding a probe and arrest of culprit within twelve hours said that attack on tribals in Hemant Soren government has gone up. Incident like Chaibasa is a blot on the face of Soren government which claims to be real well wisher of tribals.

On Tuesday evening a marriage party passing through Haj House was attacked by miscreants. The attack occurred near the spot where anti-CAA protestors are sitting on dharna for more than two months.

The BJP legislators demanding action against those behind the incident entered the well of the House raising slogans against the Government terming it as anti-tribal. As BJP legislators demand intensified Women, Child Development and Social Security Minister Joba Majhi said that government has taken several decisions in Burugulikera village of Chaibasa. Chief Minister Hemant Soren had visited the area and assured to provide necessary help and assistance to the victims’ family members.

However, Munda said that while on one hand government is restricting opposition from meeting victim family members there is no such restrictions for Chief Minister and his ministers.

Seven villagers were killed by pro-Pathalgari activists at Gulikera village under Gudri thana area in West Singhbhum district in January this year.

The BJP legislators keep on raising their demand at well of House but as uproar increases the Speaker requested the BJP MLAs to return to their chair.

Meanwhile, in another development Sahishta Parveen, Tabrej Ansari’s widow met Chief Minister Hemant Soren. Congress MLA from Jamtara Irfan Ansari accompanied Parveen. Parveen informed the Chief Minister that her husband Tabrej Alam was murdered by a mob on June 17, 2019 while he was coming to home from Jamshedpur in Kadamdiha. Parveen also gave the Chief Minister the detailed information regarding the case of her husband Tabrez Ansari through an application and pleaded justice. The widow requested Chief Minister for financial support from the government. In this regard, the Chief Minister assured him of all possible help from the state Government.

Title: Ex-gratia payment hiked for jawans killed in Naxal violence
Article:
The Chhattisgarh government on Wednesday hiked ex-gratia payment to martyred security personnel killed in Maoist-related violence in the state to Rs 20 from the earlier Rs 3 lakh, an official order said.

The state home department order said the amount of the ex-gratia payments will be based on the proposal of the state police headquarters, and in line with the new guidelines given by the Centre.

The hike in the ex-gratia payments has been incorporated for the next of kin of jawans killed in Naxal violence, the order said.

Title: ACB arrests ASI, Govt employees for taking bribe
Article:
Teams of Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Wednesday arrested two persons for taking bribe one from Ranchi and second from Jamshedpur.

An Assistant Sub Inspector Mithilesh Prasad Singh was arrested, while taking bribe by an ACB team. He was posted at Sukhdeoanagar Police Station in Ranchi District. This is the third trap of ACB this year. The ACB has said that it took this action on the complaint of Rahul Dev Upadhyay. Rahul Upadhyay, resident of Road No-6 of Indrapuri of Sukhdeoanagar Police Station area. He had given a written application to the bureau that his wife had filed a case number 34/2020 under section 498 (A) against him at Sukhdevanagar Police Station on January 18. Singh was investigation the case.

Upadhyay informed that Singh called Upadhyay to meet him outside the police station. “The Sub-Inspector told me that if I give Rs 15,000 to him, then he will help me in the case and also said that if the money is not given, he will report against him in the court.
